content:
What a great idea to grab a coffee before exploring the exhibit!

And **absolutely**, it's a great idea to ask the museum staff about kid-friendly food options or snacks available at the café! Museums often cater to families and may have a variety of options that are suitable for kids. By asking ahead, you can:

* Ensure that the café has options that your niece will enjoy and that fit her dietary needs or restrictions
* Avoid a potential meltdown or disappointment if the café doesn't have anything she likes
* Plan ahead and budget for snacks or meals that fit your needs and preferences

Some questions you could ask the museum staff include:

* Do you have any kid-friendly food options or snacks available at the café?
* Are there any healthy snack options or meals that would be suitable for children?
* Do you have any options that are gluten-free, vegetarian, or vegan?
* Can we bring our own snacks or food into the café or exhibit areas?
* Are there any special deals or discounts for kids' meals or snacks?

By asking these questions, you can help ensure that your niece has a positive experience at the café and that you're prepared for any food-related needs that may arise during your visit.

Remember, it's always better to ask ahead and plan accordingly, especially when it comes to food and kids!
